meanings.definition: A tooth on the rim of a wheel or gear that engages with another gear to transmit motion.
meanings.sent1: The small cog turned the big wheel.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the cogs fit together perfectly for the machine to work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used a cog as a tiny seat for a ride.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of life, we are all just cogs in the wheel.
meanings.sent5: The shiny cog gleamed as it spun around the axle.

meanings.definition: A subordinate member of an organization who performs necessary but usually minor or routine functions.
meanings.sent1: Every cog in the company contributes to its success.
meanings.sent2: The new employee started as a small cog but quickly proved their worth.
meanings.sent3: The office party planner was the unsung hero, a vital cog in the team.
meanings.sent4: Without each cog doing its part, the organization would not function smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Even the smallest cog plays a crucial role in the big machine of business.

meanings.sent1: He tried to cog his way into getting a better deal.
meanings.sent2: She cogs her words to make them sound more convincing.
meanings.sent3: The magician cogs the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent4: Don't let anyone cog you into believing something that isn't true.
meanings.sent5: The con artist tried to cog the old lady out of her savings.
